nettingFSI module¶

  • University of Stavanger

  • Hui Cheng (PhD student)

  • Lin Li (Medveileder)

  • Prof. Muk Chen Ong (Supervisor)

Any questions about this code, please email: hui.cheng@uis.no

In order to use this module, we recommend import nettingFSI as fsi in the beginning of your code. To use this module, one should be import this into the input file for calculations.

nettingFSI.finish_flag(cwd, flag)¶
Parameters

  • cwd – work path

  • flag – file name [string]

Returns

create a empty file to tell openfoam the file finishes writing

nettingFSI.get_position_aster(table_aster)¶

Module public function.

Parameters

table_aster – A table from Code_Aster by POST_RELEVE_T command with NOM_CHAM=(‘DEPL’)

Returns

[np.array].shape=(N,3) Unit: [m]. A numpy array of all the nodes positions.

nettingFSI.get_velocity(cwd, length_velocity, time_aster)¶
Parameters

  • cwd – working path for code aster

  • length_velocity – the length of the list of element(or vlocity)

  • time_aster – the time in Code_Aster

Returns

a numpy array of velocity on elements

nettingFSI.get_velocity_aster(table_aster)¶

Module public function.

Parameters

table_aster – A table from Code_Aster by POST_RELEVE_T command with NOM_CHAM=(‘VITE’)

Returns

[np.array].shape=(N,3) Unit: [m/s]. A numpy array of all the nodes velocities.

nettingFSI.read_velocity(cwd_foam_root, length_velocity)¶
Parameters

  • cwd_foam_root – work path

  • length_velocity – The length of velocity file, normally equal to the length of elements

Returns

return the velocity dictionary and time in openfoam

nettingFSI.start_flag(cwd, flag)¶
Parameters

  • cwd – work path

  • flag – file name [string]

Returns

create a empty file to tell openfoam the file starts writing

nettingFSI.write_element(hydro_element, cwd)¶
Parameters

  • position – A numpy array of all the net panel element

  • cwd – work path,

Returns

write the net panels to “constant” folder as a file named “surf”

nettingFSI.write_fh(hydro_force, timeFE, cwd)¶
Parameters

  • position – A numpy array of all the hydrodynamic forces on net panel

  • cwd – work path,

Returns

write the hydrodynamic forces to “constant” folder as a file named “Fh” and save the total hydrodynamic forces on netting to “forceOnNetting.txt”

nettingFSI.write_position(position, cwd)¶
Parameters

  • position – A numpy array of all the nodes’ position

  • cwd – work path,

Returns

write the nodes’ positions to “constant” folder as a file named “posi”
